passages.text: ASIA- PACIFIC excl. Japan | Autos & Auto Parts BYD
When the Gravy Train Slows; D/G BYD A/H to Underperform/Hold Post 2Q25 Miss

BYD's 2Q25 earnings delivered a jarring miss, with NP dropping \(30\%\) yoy to RMB6.4 bn, well short of JEF and cons sets of RMB10 bn+. The suprising underperformance stems from a confluence of lackluster sales momentum and structural headwinds eroding its once- formidable competitive moat. In short, BYD's "gravy train"- fueled by scale, cost cuts, and tech leadershiphas lost speed. Until it regains momentum, underperformance looks likely.

Earnings Miss Driven by Sales Weakness and Cost Pressures. Domestic sales stagnated at flat YoY in 2Q, even as overseas volumes hit a record 258k units (driving 2Q total sales to 1.1 million units, up \(14\% /16\%\) QoQ/YoY). However, this overseas strength could not offset mounting pressures in China. The "anti- involution" regulatory campaign curbed BYD's historic playbook: leveraging vertical integration to fund aggressive price cuts, which once let it grab market share at minimal profitability while pushing rivals into losses. Now, without that price- cutting leverage, BYD struggles to amortize heavy fixed costs from its vertical integration (e.g., R&D, capex). This hurt margins: 2Q gross profit margin (GPM) slid to \(16.3\%\) down 3.8 percentage points QoQ. Other profit drags included a \(\sim \mathsf{RMB}1\) bn one- off rebate to dealers (to defend market share), rising vehicle costs from the "God's Eye" AD system, and higher- than- expected capex (RMB80 bn in 1H vs. a FY25 target of RMB100 bn). As a result, net profit per car declined sharply to RMB4.9k in 2Q from RMB8.7k in 1Q.

Competitive Moat Erodes as Peers Close the Gap. BYD's core strengths- cost leadership from vertical integration and scale, plus tech leadership such as in PHEV DM5.0- appears to be fraying. Rivals like Geely and Leapmotor, in our view, now offer better specs at competitive prices (e.g., advanced AD features), neutralizing BYD's DM5.0 edge. Meanwhile, BYD's DiPilot intelligent driving solution still lags industry benchmarks. With the "anti- involution" campaign limiting price warfare, BYD can't use cost advantages to outmaneuver peers, so its scale- driven cost model has faltered- pressuring unit depreciation and margins further.

Revised Outlook and Rating- Downgrade. Given 1H results and relentless domestic competition, we cut our 2025- 2027 earnings forecasts. For 2H25, we now project 3Q/4Q NP at RMB8.6 bn/RMB14 bn/ from prior estimates of RMB14 bn/RMB22 bn) and 3Q/4Q volumes at 1.2 million/2 million units (vs. 1.4 million/1.9 million prior). We also lower our long- term (LT) 2030 volume forecast to 8 million units from 10 million. Accordingly, we downgrade BYD- A to Underperform (from Buy) and BYD- H to Hold (from Buy). Our price targets are RMB92 (BYD- A) and H165 (BYD- H), based on 17x 2026E PE (1x 3Y PEG). For BYD- A, we factor in the recent 1- 6 share split; for BYD- H, we apply a \(5\%\) premium to BYD- A to derive our PT given its overseas growth potential for which we believe global investors will pay a premium.
... continued overleaf

Source: Company, Jefferies
- Maintain NEV market share, backed by the company's vertically-integrated supply chain.- High-end brands and export sales support profitability.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
- BYD's domestic sales remained under pressure, with 2025E sales volume of 4.8m units.- A/H PT of Rmb92/HK\$105 based on 17x 2026E PE.
- Higher-than-expected EV sales of in 2025E/2026E.- A/H PT of Rmb162/HK\$185 based on 30x 2026E PE.
- Lower-than-expected EV sales in 2025E.- A/H PT of Rmb65/HK\$74 based on 12x 2026E PE.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Waste & Hazardous Materials Management are major concerns to BYD. In accordance with the Water Pollution Prevention and Control Law, the Air Pollution Prevention and Control Law, and other laws and regulations, BYD Group has established the ISO14001 environmental management system and related environmental management regulations to control the discharge of various types of wastes and effectively reduce pollutant emissions. 2) Labor practices are important ESG issues for BYD. The company should prioritize equal opportunity and avoid discrimination based on age, gender, ethnicity, religion, etc.

Company Target(s): 1) Follow the Global Memorandum of Understanding on Zero Emission Medium and Heavy Vehicles. 2) Obtain China's first SGS certificate for commitment to carbon- neutral compliance statement.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) How you control hazardous substances from vehicles and how to monitor them? 2) What are you testing in to achieve your firm's ESG goals? 3) What is the monitoring process of the product quality and safety?

- Higher-than-expected sales volume of DM-i series.- Higher-than-expected sales volume of Ocean series.- Listing and development of its semiconductor business.- News about new battery orders from other major OEMs.

Overseas: A Bright Spot Amid Domestic Gloom. Overseas remained a standout with 1H25 revenue up \(130\%\) YoY as BYD expanded in South America, Europe, Southeast Asia, and the Middle East. Brazil, Belgium, and the UK became its top three export markets (18%/10%/9% of total export volume in 1H25). BYD is also de- risking logistics by aiming to grow its in- house vessel fleet to 8 ships by end- 25, while new plants in Uzbekistan and Thailand are now producing. We expect rising overseas sales to offset some domestic pricing pressure and support profitability (i.e. NP/car of RMB25k+).

BYD Company Limited is a China- based company principally engaged in the manufacture and sale of transportation equipment. The company is also engaged in the manufacture and sale of electronic parts and components and electronic devices for daily use. The company's products include rechargeable batteries and photovoltaic products, mobile phone parts and assembly, and automobiles and related products. The company mainly conducts its business in China, the United States, and Europe.

BYD Company Limited is a China- based company principally engaged in the manufacture and sale of transportation equipment. The company is also engaged in the manufacture and sale of electronic parts and components and electronic devices for daily use. The company's products include rechargeable batteries and photovoltaic products, mobile phone parts and assembly, and automobiles and related products. The company mainly conducts its business in China, the United States and Europe.
A/H PT of Rmb92/HK\$105 based on 17x 2026E PE, 1x PEG. Risks include: 1) Stronger-than- expected NEV sales in FY25, 2) margin improvement driven by overseas sales.
A/H PT of Rmb92/HK\$105 based on 17x 2026E PE, 1x PEG. Risks include: 1) weaker-than- expected NEV sales in FY25, 2) margin improvement driven by overseas sales.

Price target of HK\$22.8 is based on SOTP method, including 10x FY25e NP (excluding Zeekr), and 20x FY27e For Zeekr, discounted back to 2025, similar to other NEV. Risks: margins of NEV brands are lower than expected; asset injection at a discount from parent company.

PT of HK\$87.3 based on 15x FY27e earnings and discounted back to present value. Downside risks include 1) intensifying competition in China's NEV market and 2) setbacks on autonomous driving development. Upside risks include 1) faster-than- expected overseas expansion and 2) strong sales of EREV models.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
